DataElement.preferredName: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Tumor T Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary gestational trophoblastic tumor based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor  Clinical T Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to pathologic T stage of a gestational trophoblastic tumor (a group of interrelated trophoblastic diseases arising from pregnancy).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A group of interrelated trophoblastic diseases arising from pregnancy. They are commonly associated with hyperplasia of trophoblasts (TROPHOBLAST) and markedly elevated human CHORIONIC GONADOTROPIN. They include HYDATIDIFORM MOLE, invasive mole (HYDATIDIFORM MOLE, INVASIVE), placental-site trophoblastic tumor (TROPHOBLASTIC TUMOR, PLACENTAL SITE), and CHORIOCARCINOMA. These neoplasms have varying propensities for invasion and spread.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: A diverse group of pregnancy-related tumors characterized by excessive proliferation of trophoblasts. It includes gestational choriocarcinoma, epithelioid trophoblastic tumor, placental site trophoblastic tumor, and mixed trophoblastic tumor.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC:American Joint Committee on Cancer Cancer Staging Manual, 6th Ed., 2002

ValueDomain.preferredName: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 T Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of gestational trophoblastic tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor pT0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor pT0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gestational trophoblastic tumor with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor pT0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Gestational trophoblastic tumor with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor pT1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor pT1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gestational trophoblastic tumor confined to uterus. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor pT1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Gestational trophoblastic tumor confined to uterus. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor pT2 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor pT2 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gestational trophoblastic tumor extending to other genital structures (ovary, tube, vagina, broad ligaments) by metastasis or direct extension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor pT2 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Gestational trophoblastic tumor extending to other genital structures (ovary, tube, vagina, broad ligaments) by metastasis or direct extension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gestational trophoblastic tumor in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Gestational trophoblastic tumor in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
